channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2024040610
item.description:
Report X-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been unloaded and was on van line ready to be loaded on van when the loading package handler saw that the box was wet. Package was set aside on a spill containment pallet, then placed in a lined container shortly after. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 jugs were packed in the box upside down, with the caps in contact with the bottom of the box. This allowed stress to be applied to caps, leading to them beginning to leak inside the plastic bags. The plastic bags then also began leaking, soiling the box and other contents. The caps had some tape wrapped around them, but this appears to have been ineffective at prevent leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The external box contained mostly all of the spillage, becoming wet in the process. There was no visible wetness on conveyor belt, and only a slightly damp spot of the spill pallet. Spill neutralizer was applied to the spot. Package was placed in a lined container during inspection and reporting. During this, contents began to leak more due to manipulation. All leakage was contained by liner.

item.title: Report E-2024040459
item.description:
Report E-2024040459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: OPELIKA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11850
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the delivery hose and storage tank became compromised. Approximately 100 gallons of diesel fuel was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

The DescribePack: There is a small, dime-sized hole on the sidewall near the top of the pail/drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was placed in a bag and a yellow hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040673
item.description:
Report X-2024040673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been unloaded from trailer and had gone overhead through conveyor system as normal. Package was loaded on van during sort. The driver of the van brought the now wet and leaking box to the Ops manager for the line and the QA for the line. Spillage was cleaned using oil dry and paper towels. Package and contents were placed in a smalls sortation bin on a spill pallet. QA completed DPR as normal. However, QA noticed corrosive labels on jugs and asked me for further clarification. Upon investigation of bottles and the SDS from the shipper's website for product, these were concluded to be undiluted jugs and needed special attention per SDS. DescribePack: One of the caps of the jug appears to have broken or come off in parts during handling, allowing all liquid contents to leak out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: After consulting SDS, bottles, inner packing, and box were transferred to lined salvage been and transported to HMPA for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040643
item.description:
Report X-2024040643

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and was being sent down IC belt when granules coming from bottom of box were observed. Package was taken off IC belt and placed on spill pallet. DescribePack: There is a ~8in crack spanning from the edge to the center point of the bottom of the drum. External box does not show signs of drop or impact damage. Contents flow through crack whenever drum is moved. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was removed from external box and transferred to lined salvage drum during processing. All contents were contained during transfer.
